snippet: Oscar Health attracted venture capitalists to its technology-oriented effort, but the market is smaller than it and other start-up insurers hoped.
abstract: Oscar Health offers case study in challenges insurance companies face as they seek to compete on individual market created by Affordable Care Act; companies like Oscar flocked to market in hopes of profiting from windfall of new customers, but strictures of law have made creating viable business model difficult.
lead_paragraph: Oscar Health attracted venture capitalists to its technology-oriented effort, but the market is smaller than it and other start-up insurers hoped.

headline.main: Health Insurer Hoped to Disrupt the Industry, but Struggles in State Marketplaces

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
